definition[0]: if a vehicle or building disgorges people, they come out of it in a large group
example[0]: Cars drew up to disgorge a wedding party.
definition[1]: if something disgorges what was inside it, it lets it pour out
example[1]: Chimneys were disgorging smoke into the air.
definition[2]: if a river disgorges, it flows into the sea
example[2]: The Mississippi disgorges its waters into the Gulf of Mexico.
definition[3]: to give back something that you have taken illegally
definition[4]: to bring food back up from your stomach through your mouth
